title: Did Dunkin’ change how we spell ‘donut’?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Wickedpedia The coffee chain’s choice of spelling decades ago may have shaped how we write "doughnut" today.
This photo provided by Dunkin' Donuts shows a selection of the doughnuts they sell.
(AP Photo/Dunkin' Donuts) Every New Englander loves Dunkin’— but did you know the brand may be the reason you spell the word “doughnut” as “donut”?

title: Anfernee Simons, Celtics catch fire late, blow out Pelicans for first win: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics Simons was a crucial part of the Celtics’ big push to put the game away with three backbreaker 3-pointers and a couple of nice defensive plays.
Boston Celtics guard Anfernee Simons (4) shoots against New Orleans Pelicans guard Jordan Hawkins (24) and center Derik Queen (22) in the second half of a game, Monday, Oct.
27, 2025, in New Orleans.

title: Bruins’ struggles continue with blowout loss to Senators 7-2
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Boston Bruins Jeremy Swayman made 17 saves for the Bruins, who are in last place in the Atlantic Division.
Ottawa Senators' Ridly Greig, center, hits the Bruins' Henri Jokiharju during the second-period.

Sean Kilpatrick/The Canadian Press via AP OTTAWA, Ontario (AP) — Drake Batherson and Tim Stutzle each had two goals and an assist to lead the Ottawa Senators over the Boston Bruins 7-2 on Monday night for their third straight win.

title: DCF releases new details about its involvement with Conn. girl found dead in storage container
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “To correct misinformation,” DCF released a timeline of their involvement with Jacqueline “Mimi” Torres-Garcia.
Her mother, aunt, and mother's boyfriend are facing charges in her death.
Jacqueline “Mimi” Torres-Garcia.

title: Breer: Belichick, Kraft could be battling for spot in 2026 Hall of Fame class
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Because of the way the numbers work, it would be very difficult for both of them to get through at once.
" Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft could both earn a spot in Canton in 2026.
John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan October 27, 2025 | 7:43 PM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Red Sox closer Aroldis Chapman slams Yankees, says he’s rather ‘retire’ than play for New York
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox "If I were told that I was being traded to New York, I'd pack my things and go home.
" Aroldis Chapman spent parts of seven seasons with the Yankees.
Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan October 27, 2025 | 6:54 PM 2 minutes to read Aroldis Chapman is now tasked with closing out games for the Boston Red Sox.

title: Myles Garrett gives ringing endorsement of Patriots’ future with Drake Maye, Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "Hate to be on this end of it, but it’s nice to see how he’s leading his team.
" Myles Garrett and Drake Maye met after the Patriots beat the Browns on Sunday afternoon.

(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) By Conor Ryan October 27, 2025 | 6:29 PM 3 minutes to read Cleveland Browns star pass-rusher Myles Garrett had a dominant performance on Sunday afternoon at Gillette Stadium, setting a franchise record with five sacks against the New England Patriots.

title: ‘Widespread practice’: Man wrongly convicted of Roxbury murder says detectives framed him
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The federal lawsuit points to a “widespread practice” of officers who forced false identifications from witnesses and routinely buried evidence ahead of trials.
A portrait of Milton Jones.
Louis D.
